meanings.sent1: The tiny mouse let out a squeaking noise.
meanings.sent2: The old door hinges were squeaking loudly.
meanings.sent3: The squeaking toy car entertained the baby for hours.
meanings.sent4: The squeaking brakes signaled the need for maintenance.
meanings.sent5: The squeaking violin added a unique touch to the music.

meanings.sent1: The puppy loves to squeaking when playing with its toy.
meanings.sent2: She was squeaking with excitement when she saw the surprise.
meanings.sent3: The squeaking bird outside woke me up early.
meanings.sent4: His shoes were squeaking on the polished floor as he walked.
meanings.sent5: The old chair kept squeaking every time someone sat on it.

meanings.definition: High-pitched sound made by something being rubbed or pressed
meanings.sent1: The constant squeaking of the swing set filled the park.
meanings.sent2: The annoying squeaking of the door hinge needed oiling.
meanings.sent3: The squeaking of the rubber duck in the bath made her smile.
meanings.sent4: The squeaking of the chalk on the blackboard was unbearable.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious squeaking in the attic gave them chills.

meanings.definition: To barely succeed or pass in a competition or test
meanings.sent1: She was squeaking by with just enough points to pass.
meanings.sent2: The team was squeaking through to the finals with a close win.
meanings.sent3: He was squeaking through the math exam with a bit of luck.
meanings.sent4: The student was squeaking by in the class with extra credit.
meanings.sent5: The car was squeaking past the finish line in the race.
